feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a greyed-out formula in the leave policy that is overridden by the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied for unpaid leave deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. The correct calculation should include 366 days for leap years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated Amount Decimal Precision Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (Bayzat: AED 231,821.10, Manual: AED 252,485). Detailed calculation breakdown revealed system uses specific service duration and daily wage formula.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex rules based on service duration and tiered daily rates
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in gratuity calculation method for end users

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing slight variations in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The specific case showed a difference between 912 and 913 total days, impacting the final calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially causing a slight overestimation in gratuity calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation, adding one extra day to total service duration
known_issues.gap_statement: Precision in days worked calculation needs refinement

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates daily wage by dividing salary over a predefined number of days (30 vs 31), which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a fixed divisor configured in leave policy, which might not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in explaining how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months.
known_issues.gap_statement: Users need a more predictable method for calculating leave salary accruals that doesn't vary with monthly working day differences.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage configurations with independent divisors (30 days vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The leave salary policy uses a different daily rate formula than salary proration, leading to inconsistent results.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage configurations that cannot be automatically aligned.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match user's initial expectations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to consistently prorate salaries when an employee's departure date differs from the payroll processing date. Specifically, the system correctly prorates salaries for past departure dates but fails to prorate for future departure dates during payroll processing.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with departure dates different from payroll processing dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap exists in handling dynamic proration scenarios for employees with future or past departure dates.

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions During Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing accurate working days calculation when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate daily wage and leave day calculations across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Produces Unexpected Results
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about precise salary calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in February remarks for daily wage calculations, despite backend calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about the daily rate calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect unpaid leave deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate recalculated based on payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary calculation is based on a fixed 26 working days per month (313 working days per year), with no automatic mechanism for proportional adjustments.
limitations.impact: Requires manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves for each employee separately

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is displayed as greyed out to indicate it will be overridden.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Consistent Decimal Rounding Issue
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amounts are consistently calculated with a slight decimal precision error, showing amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2.
limitations.impact: Affects accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are only accrued at end of month, preventing inclusion of partial month leave for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include that month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation methodology for different organizational needs

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, preventing easy overrides for specific employee scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for unique monthly variations

limitations.title: Monthly Variation in Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which varies month-to-month (e.g., 20 working days in February)
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary accruals will differ across months due to varying working day counts

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates daily wage for leave salary and salary proration using different divisors and independent configurations.
limitations.impact: Potential inconsistent salary calculations between leave periods and regular salary proration

limitations.title: Proration Based on Work Week Setup
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Salary calculation may differ based on unique work week setups

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Logic
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is only correctly applied when an employee's departure date is in the past, but fails when the departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies for employees with future departure dates

limitations.title: Inability to Automatically Reconcile Leave and Payroll Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
limitations.impact: Users must manually manage and remove duplicate or incorrect payroll deductions

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Salary deductions for unpaid leave depend on precise working days calculation, which can be affected by public holiday configurations.

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with exact calendar days
limitations.impact: Deductions may slightly differ from expected monthly salary amounts

limitations.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Based on Calendar Days
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations for unpaid leave use calendar days as the divisor, which means the daily rate varies based on the actual number of days in a month.
limitations.impact: Varying daily rates across different months due to different number of calendar days

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed instead of prorated amount

troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually review and remove duplicate deductions after modifying leave transactions

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent salary deduction for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing mismatch in public holiday configuration and leave request processing

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using different daily wage configurations with independent divisors (30 days vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The leave salary policy uses a different daily rate formula than salary proration, leading to inconsistent results.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator fails to consistently prorate salaries when an employee's departure date differs from the payroll processing date. Specifically, the system correctly prorates salaries for past departure dates but fails to prorate for future departure dates during payroll processing.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions During Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductionsâ€”one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Produces Unexpected Results
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about precise salary calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in February remarks for daily wage calculations, despite backend calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about the daily rate calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect unpaid leave deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Standard
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary calculation is based on a fixed 26 working days per month (313 working days per year), with no automatic mechanism for proportional adjustments.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is displayed as greyed out to indicate it will be overridden.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Consistent Decimal Rounding Issue
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amounts are consistently calculated with a slight decimal precision error, showing amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2.

claims_to_validate.title: Mid-Month Departure Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are only accrued at end of month, preventing inclusion of partial month leave for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, preventing easy overrides for specific employee scenarios.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Variation in Daily Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment calculations are based on working days, which varies month-to-month (e.g., 20 working days in February)

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates daily wage for leave salary and salary proration using different divisors and independent configurations.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Based on Work Week Setup
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Logic
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is only correctly applied when an employee's departure date is in the past, but fails when the departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing.

claims_to_validate.title: Inability to Automatically Reconcile Leave and Payroll Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for daily wage calculations, which may not align with exact calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Based on Calendar Days
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations for unpaid leave use calendar days as the divisor, which means the daily rate varies based on the actual number of days in a month.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays
